alert.note: Alert for Eastern Albany; Eastern Schenectady; Southern Saratoga; Southern Washington; Western Rensselaer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 3:47AM EST until January 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 1 PM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...The Capital District and southern Washington County in eastern New York. * WHEN...From 4 PM this afternoon to 1 PM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening or Wednesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will begin later this afternoon and will continue through tonight before transitioning to a wintry mix, including freezing rain, Wednesday morning. Precipitation will change over to plain rain by Wednesday afternoon as temperatures rise above freezing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Albany; Eastern Schenectady; Southern Saratoga; Southern Washington; Western Rensselaer
